statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ -2 \\ -8 \\ -7 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 1 \\ 3 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -1 \\ 1 \\ -5 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 14 \\ -5 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 13 \\ -7 \\ 19 \\ -3 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ -2 \\ -8 \\ -7 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} -4 \\ 1 \\ 3 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -1 \\ 1 \\ -5 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 14 \\ -5 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 13 \\ -7 \\ 19 \\ -3 \end{array}\right].
